intro: Oryza sativa var. niponica, commonly known as Japanese rice, is a variety of rice native to East Asia. It is characterized by its slender, upright stalks and small, elongated grains. The plant typically grows to a height of 100–150 cm and produces panicles that are often more compact compared to other rice varieties. It thrives in warm, wet climates and requires a long growing season with ample sunlight. The botanical features of this variety make it well-suited for both culinary and agricultural use in its native region.
